Body:
I have been trying to set up I2C communication between my Raspberry Pi and two arduino pro minis using this tutorial:

https://learn.adafruit.com/adafruits-raspberry-pi-lesson-4-gpio-setup/configuring-i2c

I have done all the steps correctly
column9: installed all the required dependencies and modified all the required files
column10: yet "sudo i2cdetect -y 1" does not detect the arduinos. I have two PCF8591 AD/DA converter modules
column11: and when I connect them to the RPi using the SCL and SDA ports
column12:
they are detected and shown by "sudo i2cdetect -y 1". But the arduinos do not show up. This is How I have connected the RPi and the Arduino Minis:

RPi -> Arduino

3.3V -> Vin

GND -> GND

SDA(GPIO2) -> SDA(A4)

SCL(GPIO3) -> SCL(A5)

I would like to know what is going wrong here. Please suggest.

"

Body: I2C bus basically has a single master and slave devices attached. Not sure how to do this but have you configured your arduino to be a slave?

Yes, I too realised this a little too late that there no difference between the RPi(master) and the Arduinos(slave) in this circuit. The Arduinos need to be configured to be used as slaves. I am studying about that, will say when I find out how this is done.
I studied about setting different addresses and came across these two pages:	https://oscarliang.com/raspberry-pi-arduino-connected-i2c/	https://www.arduino.cc/en/Tutorial/MasterWriter

I tried uploading the Slave Receiver Sketch from the later to the Minis, but they failed with errors. I tried uploading the sketch to UNOs, and the upload was successful. Now when I have configured the two UNOs using two different addresses, they show up on i2cdetect.

So, the doubt in this question has been solved. But it would be very convenient for my project to use the Mini Arduinos. I have opened a new thread about the problems regarding my Mini Arduinos here:	https://www.experts-exchange.com/questions/29020889/Problem-uploading-sketch-and-burning-bootloader-to-Arduino-Pro-Mini.html		Please go through it and help me out if possible.
